heggal.name: Heggal
heggal.description: On the holiday of the Harvest Feast, Heggal left his home to spread the word of the goddess Irori. Obsessed with the Master’s Rebus, he set himself to learning its truths. Sadly for his studies, he did this investigation in most of the taverns of the Inner Sea. He soon learned he was better suited to the worship of Cayden Cailean, god of intoxication. On Merrymead, in the fulsome company of wild revelers, he chose a new path, and he has never looked back.

hyra.name: Kyra
hyra.description: Kyra and her family grew up near a small temple to Sarenrae, the goddess of healing, honesty, redemption, and the sun. When bandits attacked Kyra’s village, Sarenrae’s priestesses defended the innocent, driving off the raiders at the cost of their lives and their sanctuary. Standing in the burned ruin of the temple, young Kyra swore her life and sword arm to the goddess, promising mercy to the deserving and a quick death to those who spread in darkness.

zarlova.name: Zarlova
zarlova.description: In the city of Oenopion, Zarlova is a well-known professor at the Hive, an academy of wizards and clerics working in concert to discover mysteries left by the god Nethys. A master of The Book of Magic, Zarlova routinely ventures from the halls of academia to spread knowledge among the unenlightened. She is willing to sacrifce just about anything to advance her understanding of the world: money, goods, animals, or even parts of herself.

tarlin.name: Tarlin
tarlin.description: As a recruit of the Eagle Knights, Tarlin has been assigned guardianship over caravans along the River Road, a path that leads to the demonically devastated Worldwound. He rallies both nobles and peasants to his side, inspiring them with the good word of Iomedae. Due to his talent with weapons, paladins consider him one of their own. Should the Light of the Sword call him to battle, he will brandish his weapon against all who stand in Iomedae’s way
